name: 3D Distance Formula
statement: The distance between two points in 3D is √((x₂−x₁)² + (y₂−y₁)² + (z₂−z₁)²).
philosophy: An extension of the Pythagorean theorem to three dimensions.

name: 3D Midpoint Formula
statement: The midpoint of segment AB in 3D is the average of each coordinate component.
philosophy: Extends planar midpoint logic to three coordinates.

name: Dot Product in 3D
statement: The dot product of two vectors is a·b = axbx + ayby + azbz.
philosophy: Connects angle between vectors to scalar computation.

name: Orthogonality via Dot Product
statement: Two vectors are orthogonal if and only if their dot product is zero.
philosophy: A simple algebraic criterion for perpendicularity in space.

name: Cross Product in 3D
statement: The cross product of vectors a and b is a vector perpendicular to both.
philosophy: Produces normal vectors and allows computation of oriented areas.

name: Plane Equation
statement: A plane in 3D is given by Ax + By + Cz + D = 0.
philosophy: Canonical representation of a plane in space, used in intersection and distance calculations.

name: Point to Plane Distance
statement: The distance from point (x₀, y₀, z₀) to plane Ax+By+Cz+D=0 is |Ax₀ + By₀ + Cz₀ + D| / √(A² + B² + C²).
formal: d = |Ax₀ + By₀ + Cz₀ + D| / √(A² + B² + C²)
philosophy: Measures shortest path from a point to a surface.

name: Volume of a Tetrahedron
statement: The volume of a tetrahedron defined by three vectors is (1/6)|a·(b×c)|.
philosophy: Connects scalar triple product to 3D volume.
